thread.title: Arsenal transfer news: Jack Wilshere CANNOT be recalled from season-long loan spell at Bournemouth despite Gunners having NO fit central midfielders
thread.title_full: Arsenal transfer news: Jack Wilshere CANNOT be recalled from season-long loan spell at Bournemouth despite Gunners having NO fit central midfielders

author: dcutts
title: Arsenal transfer news: Jack Wilshere CANNOT be recalled from season-long loan spell at Bournemouth despite Gunners having NO fit central midfielders
text:
2 Loanee Jack Wilshere is ineligible to play parent club Arsenal 
Francis Coquelin is also suffering from a hamstring problem, Granit Xhaka is suspended for four-matches and Mohamed Elneny is away at the Africa Cup of Nations. 
Santi Cazorla is also missing for an indefinite amount of time after having surgery in Sweden on a chronic Achilles problem before Christmas. Getty Images 2 The Emirates boss could make his return to the sidelines for the Bayern Munich game after his red 
Wenger would be desperate to recall Wilshere from his spell at Bournemouth , where he is having a fine season and has had a regular run of games. 
But SunSport understands a clause was NOT put into the deal to allow him to be recalled back to the Emirates when he joined the Cherries . 
Arsenalâ€™s title challenge suffered a shocking blow tonight after a surprise defeat to Watford , leaving them nine points behind leaders Chelsea. More on Arsenal DEADLINE DAY LIVE Transfer window is CLOSED! But who managed to get their last bit of business done before the 11pm deadline? Hornets Honour Troy Deeney pays tribute to Graham Taylor and says win over Arsenal is for late Hornets boss 22-1 record Arsenal defender Shkodran Mustafi loses his unbeaten record as Gunners lose Watford Wat a Surprise Arsenal 1 Watford 2: Younes Kaboul and Troy Deeney strike early as Hornets put major dent in Arsene Wenger's title hopes at the Emirates Wat a Surprise Arsenal 1 Watford 2: Younes Kaboul and Troy Deeney strike early as Hornets put major dent in Arsene Wenger's title hopes at the Emirates Ram-Blow Aaron Ramsey adds to Arsenal's injury woes after limping off inside 20 minutes during clash with Watford Done Deal Arsenal prodigy Stephy Mavididi joins Charlton on loan until the end of the season HINDS-SIGHT Arsenal loan Kaylen Hinds to Stevenage until the end of the season - after signing youngster to new deal Jack Wilshere reveals which Arsenal player has the most magic in his feet 
Wenger takes his side to Stamford Bridge in Saturday's earlier kick-off with just Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain able to fill a central midfield role. 
Gunners supporters will be furious with the revelation that Wilshere cannot return for what is a must-win match.
